text: Stable Mable is an album led by saxophonist Dexter Gordon recorded in 1975 and released on the Danish SteepleChase label.Dexter Gordon discography, accessed March 17, 2015SteepleChase Records discography, accessed March 17, 2015 ==Reception== In his review for AllMusic, Scott Yanow said "Dexter Gordon is in frequently exuberant form on this quartet session ...the veteran tenor sounds quite inspired throughout the joyous outing". ==Track listing== # "Just Friends" (John Klenner, Sam M. Lewis) - 7:59 # "Misty" (Johnny Burke, Erroll Garner) - 8:18 # "Red Cross" (Charlie Parker) - 7:51 # "So What" (Miles Davis) - 8:23 # "In a Sentimental Mood" (Duke Ellington, Manny Kurtz, Irving Mills) - 6:54 # "Stablemates" (Benny Golson) - 9:56 # "Just Friends" [Alternate Take] (Klenner, Lewis) - 8:09 Bonus track on CD reissue # "Misty" [Alternate Take] (Burke, Garner) - 7:45 Bonus track on CD reissue # "Red Cross" [Alternate Take] (Parker) - 6:12 Bonus track on CD reissue ==Personnel== *Dexter Gordon - tenor saxophone, soprano saxophone *Horace Parlan - piano *Niels-Henning Orsted Pedersen - bass *Tony Inzalaco - drums ==References== Category:1975 albums Category:Dexter Gordon albums Category:SteepleChase Records albums
title: Stable Mable
